Title:
Establishment of monokaryotic and dikaryotic isolates of
Hedgehog mushrooms (Hydnum repandum and its relatives) from
basidiospores
Keywords:
Cantharellales, Ectomycorrhizal fungus, Edible mushroom,
Nuclear phase, Spore isolation
Abstract:
Hydnum repandum and its relatives are gourmet edible
ectomycorrhizal mushrooms. However, no one reported those reliable pure
cultures. Here we reported for the first time the successful isolation
of mycelial strains from basidiospores in genus Hydnum. Basidiospores
obtained from basidioma samples were aseptically inoculated onto
modified NorkranÂ’s C (MNC) medium, MNC containing n-butyric acid (n-MNC),
or MNC with gellan-gum instead of agar (G-MNC). Although basidiospore
germination was observed in most samples, the isolation rate was higher
from MNC (91.7%) and G-MNC (93.8%) than from n-MNC (36.4%). Most
established isolates were monokaryotic and lacked a clamp connection,
but three were dikaryotic and had clamp connections. Established
isolates were identified by molecular phylogenetic analyses of the
internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region of the rRNA gene. These results
suggest that basidiospores are useful to establish monokaryotic and
dikaryotic isolates of Hydnum species.
